author: Michael Bürgi
title: Canadian indie Salt XC expands its U.S. presence with purchase of Craft & Commerce
description: Less than a year after buying Nectar First, an AI-driven specialist, Salt XC has expanded its full-service media offerings with the purchase of Craft and Commerce.
content: There may be trade tensions between the U.S. and Canada thanks to on-again off-again tariff threats, but thats not stopping a Canadian-based independent shop from gaining a stronger foothold in the U… [+3696 chars]

author: Anthony Vargas
title: OOH Is Getting New Rules For Categorizing Venues In Programmatic Buys
description: Traditionally, digital out-of-home (OOH) inventory is grouped by venue type. But programmatic buyers want to know exactly what they’re bidding on – which is why generic categories like “retail” or “transit” just don’t cut it anymore. Not to mention that when …

author: David Hurwitz
title: Why Marketing Lost Its Long View – And How To Get It Back
description: Marketing has an uncomfortable habit we rarely acknowledge: We’re addicted to short-termism. For more than a decade, dashboards and last-click attribution have quietly dictated strategy. These tools were never built to explain how marketing drives growth; the…
